website_summaries.verdict: The V-Moda Crossfade LP headphones look good, feel durable, and offer plenty of desirable extras, but the clubby leaning to the sound space does not lend itself well to all genres of music. This set is best suited to DJs and dance music aficionados.
pros: The V-Moda Crossfade LP headphones feature an eye-catching design and solid construction that offers a comfy fit
The package includes several nice extras such as detachable cloth-covered cables, an iPhone/iPod remote and inline mic, and a stylish hard-sided case
cons: The Crossfade LP headphones don't offer the most balanced audio response, and they don't fold down flat for easy transport

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: Got these a while back, the build quality is amazing. They can sure take whatever you throw at it. The cables were almost unbreakable . Comes in a great solid carrying kit. Sound quality is decent, but im no audio expert. Dislikes....Cannot wear for long periods of time. iIt is comfortable when I first put it on, but it hurts my ears if I wear them any time close to 1 hour. Maybe my ears are too big. So look for something that would encompass your ears and not rest on them. I could not watch an entire movie with these on.
customer_reviews.author: Anand Ramtahal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, though not completely over-ear for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a snob for sound quality so I can't really comment on that. Suffice to say they sound good enough to me. The color is gorgeous, for those concerned that "rouge" means or could look pink I can confirm that these are in fact clearly red and black. The construction feels solid and I've been rolling over the cord for months now with no issues. My only complaint, which I re-iterated in my review of the XL cushions I bought to make it bigger, is that I wouldn't say they are completely "over-ear". Even with the XL pads it doesn't encompass my entire ear. I use them without a problem but wish they were slightly bigger.
customer_reviews.author: robunshaft

customer_reviews.title: Works like new after 7 years of use!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of headphones. I wouldn't call it noise cancelling, it's more of a noise-deadening but it does manage to keep out a lot of noise IE I wouldn't be able to have a conversation with someone 5 feet away with these on. The sound quality is excellent and the build quality is out of this world. I've had these for 7 years and aside from some of the cloth on the band wearing away, they work as if they were new. No problems. Highly highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jklick

customer_reviews.title: Going strong after six years and around 500 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these six years ago and used them regularly for two years while I was in college. Since then, I use them a few hours a month and when I go on trips. They have held up very well. The only area showing age is the around-the-ear pad which has thinned and developed fine wrinkles. No issues in feel or performance and I believe that piece is replaceable. Sound quality is very good considering the price and the year they were purchased 2012.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McNeely

customer_reviews.title: The clamp pressure got me running from them
customer_reviews.text: Clamp pressure was a killer. So much I really got disinterest in breaking them in. I know stretching them can release clamp a little, but these are just too much! Excessive, it just hurts you so bad. Wish they weren't like this, for the price I would think they could afford good quality comfort for us, they do not.
customer_reviews.author: The_Blacked_IPs

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: They sound awesome! They fit good and are extremely comfortable to wear how ever the plastic headphone casing isn’t the most ideal material because over time they crack wear the screws are screwed into. I take extremely good care of my stuff and keep them in the case and they still got hair line cracks in the plastic. Everything else is durable and good quality material. Would buy again for the quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. They feel good on my head (large head), and are comfortable to wear for a long time. They do tend to get a bit sweaty if its warm in the room, but this is common with many other headsets as well. The inclusion of a hard case has allowed me to carry these around the world without incident. I like that the cables are all nylon braided, that prevents the cord from getting tangled in other cables and sticking due to that weird rubbery plastic they use (apple I'm looking at you). You can also customize, but thats not really a deciding factor for me, and I've not done so.
customer_reviews.author: PMAC

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about these except they fit a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for a while now. While they sound great and keep a lot of background noise out, they give me a headache if I wear them any longer than an hour. The band is strong, but after a while I feel the weight of it on the crown of my head. The speakers also press tightly against my ears. I realize this is a trade off between having good enclosure and sound quality vs comfort. Maybe I'm just sensitive. My head isn't large by any means. I wear a size 7 ball cap. I'd love to give these 5 stars, but I have to nick one star for the lack of long-term wear comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hammerberg

customer_reviews.title: Great beautiful headsets with excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you don't judge these until you burn them in. Pretty nice headsets with a healthy range and depth of sound. Beautiful design- so I'm actually not embarrassed to wear them! Quality components- had them a little over a year and nothing has broken, much less scratched. I was worried about my hair gel messing up the band or denaturing the mesh and covering (it is water based), but it seems to play nice with these materials. The case is super useful and I love that you can detach the cord for storage/ or get a longer one if needed. I use for everything from plane rides, to video gaming, to cell phone calls. Not a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Net

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted me 5 years and still rockin
customer_reviews.text: I bout these about 5 years ago in college and used them as my primary headphones for 5 years. They have always sounded great and are a real workhorse. I used these things not only for listening to music but also for editing videos (as I am a professional videographer). Fast forward 5 years and they are still working great. The leather padding just now started to flake a little and on the head band too, but I am surprised it has lasted this long. I still use it as my primary headphone and I am only going to buy another one just so I don't get flakes on my ear anymore. Great buy! Worth the money! Underpriced!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Minchew

customer_reviews.title: A great company, a great product.
customer_reviews.text: The best headphone I've ever used. The best company i've come across. Simply a pleasant experience. I bought these back in 2012, they're still going strong. I actually had on point after 4 years of use, where the sound stopped working out of one of the earcups, guess what? V-moda and their excellent service fixed them for free!!!! that's 4 years later...are you kidding me??? What company on the market right now will fix something that old, let alone for free. You cannot name a single one. This company cares about their customers. For that they have gained a lifetime customer. The headphones are still going strong in 2017. Kevlar cable..still strong. Everything about these headphones is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: sounds and looks great
customer_reviews.text: sound 9/10 style 9/10 construction quality 10/10 Bass 10/10 overal 9,5/10 I still use every once in while after 3 years. the still look new although i have to mention that I only occasionally use them outside. mostly in my room basically. still quite impressed with the build quality. they are not the most clear and crisp sounding. their sound is a bit grainy and muddy but they are very musical and sweet sounding. for the price quite a winner. The bass is very present but not overpowering. I like it and its the biggest selling point for these phones. recommended
customer_reviews.author: DaaDaa

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting bass hitting Beast
customer_reviews.text: I bought these like 5 years ago,but never reviewed them.In those 5 years I've bought maybe 15 pairs of of headphones.These ones are still kicking strong.most headphones are plastic or plastic parts these are metal so never had any issue with them,very comfortable and like I said still going Hopefully I'm still in Amazon system so it comes up a verified purchase.now these ain't for everyone Bass heavy listening is there thing although you can adjust it with app eq settings if prefer less.only thing that failed was cable after Idk maybe 2 years.i recommend for teenagers who are hard on there stuff these can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: excellent buy for those looking for a great pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an excellent pair of great sounding headphones your search stops here. I've been a DJ for more than 10 years and have gone through more headphones than a normal person, I know what normally breaks and how uncomfortable a pair can be after 5 hours at a gig. I bought these based on word of mouth and could not be any happier. They are crisp, loud and very comfortable. They are a lower profile so don't look enormous when they are on. I like how they can be customized also. Just get them
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. Still have them after 5 years probably listen to them every day at work. Great noise isolation and still sound awesome. Only problem that I have with them is that after about 4 years the leather on the headband started to come off. Doesnt interfere with the functionality at all and heck might have even been my fault for not maintaining the leather correctly. Damn things are great, were built to last and worth the 100 bucks I spent at the time.
customer_reviews.author: archangel59

customer_reviews.title: Just What They Promise!
customer_reviews.text: "... deep vibrant bass, organic mid-range, and high-end clarity..." Extraordinary clarity, in fact, as good as my "open" studio headphones at three times the price. I'm always in the market for headphones, partly because I destroy them with my outdoorsy lifestyle and partly because I'm never quite satisfied with the sound quality. These new phones seem to be sturdily designed and assembled, but of course "time will tell." They also claim to be "passively" noise canceling, which I think simply means that they are well fitting over the ears and thus well insulating. They are that. I have walked on a busy street with them on, turned up to concert-hall level of course, and I heard surprisingly little car noise.
customer_reviews.author: Gio

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Only thing stopping me from giving these ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Only thing stopping me from giving these headphones 5 stars is that the fabric the holds the cushion foam separated from the inside of the headphones leaving the foam exposed. Happened after about 6 months. This was covered under warranty but I didn't want to be without headphones for 3 weeks. I should add that these are super comfortable, even with the foam exposed. I routinely wear these for 10+ hours straight with 0 discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: wick

customer_reviews.title: They last...
customer_reviews.text: 2 years. I have rocked these cans for two years now. And they sound just as good now as when they were new. Sure, they have a few battle scars, but what would you expect from my go-to everyday headphones. Music, movies, voice chat, and Xbox One gaming (with the ever so awesome V-moda boom mic:  These are truly the One Headphone to Rule Them All: my quest to find headphones that are above average at everything. These are one of the best purchases I have ever made. If/when my current pair finally give up the ghost, a new pair will be finding their way to my house without even thinking about it (with a tracking number even!)
customer_reviews.author: dreifach

customer_reviews.title: The thing I like about this is the bass
customer_reviews.text: After two years of owning this, I continue to use it daily. It is definitely reliable and comfort to wear hours on end. The thing I like about this is the bass, it hits pretty hard especially with hip hop and melodic dubstep. However, because of this the treble and mids are a little muffled, not as clear. But this issue doesn't matter to me now because I plug it through a DAC from Audioengine and it works flawlessly. My only complaint is that the microphone does not work when its plugged into my PC and or my Android phone. So if the mic is important to you, don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones not over-ear
customer_reviews.text: They're a nice pair of headphones overall, decent sound and an appearance I like. However being marketed as over-ear doesnt seem correct, the ear pads are far to small, and I ended up having to wear them as on-ear which I really didnt want because it hurts my ears. I recently bought the XL memory cushions which were much larger and fixed the problem, but I dont feel like I should have to buy an ad-on piece to make them work as they're labled.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: They hold up great
customer_reviews.text: Ive had these headphones since 2012 or something like that and they are still going strong the only downside is that the plastic film on the headband is pealing off and its not looking so pretty, the plastic on the cushion ear pieces are doing the same too :( maybe its time to upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Spazz

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST HEADPHONES IN MY HEADPHONE ARSENAL
customer_reviews.text: I have the following headphones in my headphone arsenal: V-Moda Crossfade M-100, V-Moda Crossfade LP2, V-MODA Crossfade LP, V-Moda True Blood V-80, Sennheiser PXC 450, Audio-Technica ATH-M50 & Shure SRH440. Comparing all these... all the V-Moda headphones win! The V-MODA Crossfade LP performance is almost the same with the V-Moda Crossfade M-100 and V-Moda Crossfade LP2... performance wise... with only some minor differences. You might notice that there are no Bose and Beats headphones listed. Why?... because with V-Moda Crossfade headphones, who needs the overpriced Bose and Beats headphones? V-Moda Crossfade headphones sound quality is still the best in the market! Ask the pros... they'll tell you the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Espejo

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Two Cords and Just the Right Amount of Noise-Cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I use these everyday when working out, sometimes when I work in the yard, and sometime when out shopping. They block most noise, even with something loud like a lawnmower, but they're not so noise-canceling that I can't hear noises around me at all. They're extremely comfortable, have incredibly sound quality, and are very comfortable even aftera wearing for extended periods of time. I always get lots of compliments about how cool they look as well. Pros: - comfortable design - comes with two cords should one break (one with and one without the mic) - great sound quality - they look great - durable so far after 1 & a half years of daily use
customer_reviews.author: Stfortn - male born in 1988

customer_reviews.title: V-Moda Crossfade Over-Ear Noise-Isolating Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to review these headphones after I had a chance to use them on a cross country plane trip. With that said, they worked exceptionally well at muting most of the ambient cabin noises so that I could enjoy watching a movie on my laptop. The headphones are really nice to look at. Someone definitely designed these for comfort and to turn heads. Even the accompanying case was designed to fit the headphones perfectly. There are two headphone cords included, one of which has an in-line microphone and which to my amazement, works with my Microsoft Lumia 640. There are also a couple of adapters for versatility and a d-ring for hooking it to your backpack, briefcase etc.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest

customer_reviews.title: not related to packaging I was sorely disappointed. Barely any volume
customer_reviews.text: If it was all about packaging, this product would get 6 stars out of 5...but it's not. In every other aspect, not related to packaging I was sorely disappointed. Barely any volume, hardly any bass. Sound quality was decent but not excellent. Makes me wonder if reviews I read were planted by maunufacturer. I don't see how anyone could have a $200 asking price for the quality I received. I did get them for $120, but even that was too much. I have gotten much better sound quality out of headphones for half the price. I would not recommend purchasing these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: MWDavid

customer_reviews.title: Too much bass for my taste
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this LP. Okay, the material that is made is strong, durable and beautiful. It comes with 2 detachable cables (red and black), one with mic and volume control, the other without. The cushion of the over the ear headphones are very soft and comfortable. I would admit that for my head (small) the headphone feels a little heavy--just a little. Now the sound is not good for me---too much bass. Not only that, but the bass bleed into the mids and highs. I tried to like it in so many ways so many times (more than a year), but it didn't work for me. It became unbearable. I do not recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: WilliamRafael

customer_reviews.title: For the money: seriously good sound and reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, reliable sound quality across the board. I listen to a wide variety of music via internet, CD, and vinyl. These have consistently been the best headphones I have used. They handle high volume without distortion or even much leakage to the world around you. The tones are clear enough that you can differentiate individual melody lines and instruments. They have proven to be resilient and sturdy as well. I don't use them in my day to day walking around, but I do travel with them. I've had them for almost two years, since I moved to NYC (spare the roommates my late-night music and movie tendencies) and they have continued to impress. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy headphones that have lasted me over 4 years of heavy use. Great audio quality for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones back in 2013 and they are still as good as good as the first day as bought them. V-Moda really knows how to make a durable pair of headphones. I've used them on a regular basis since I got them, taking them on several different international trips. I'm not an audiophile, but i'm very happy with the audio quality from these headphones, given the price I paid. The headphones can get uncomfortable to wear after a few hours, but this problem became nonexistent after I bought the XL cushions for the headphones. Great product, would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Austin Sun

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever had but some important notes;
customer_reviews.text: I bought the V-MODA Crossfade LP (Rogue) thinking the mic that came with it was PC compatible, I was wrong. I recommend buying these two things with your order of these headphones: Regular headset adapter which allows for microphone compatibility with regular PC applications like Skype USB adapter - trust me - sound quality improved EVEN MORE SO than just regular plug to jack. That said, everything else is perfect. Lightweight, stays in place, doesn't hurt my ears, no sweat, amazing sound. EDIT;; Got an adapter for mic use on Skype, mic quality below average Sound is very far away, would be fine for using on small devices, cells, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I'M IN LOVE. Listening to a music is a hobby of mine. Really though, I listen to music for fun. So I take my music very seriously, especially the way it sounds to me. These headphones are incredible. As advertised they are noise-isolating--you can't hear anything but your tunes. They're super sexy; I wear them at the gym every day and have gotten the most envious looks. I love the sound of these phones. The bass and the treble are equally balanced, unlike brands such as Beats. For the price, these headphones are absolutely incredible. I would recommend them to anybody and everybody. I would buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck headphones
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic set of cans. Metal construction which just makes them so durable, the sound is phenomenal for the price with an even balance if lows mids and highs. The design is flawless. They look sleek, low profile, and you don't feel like you are wearing monstrosities while in public. The headband is super comfortable with a thin cloth cushion which puts no excessive pressure on your head and the earpads are perfect after a day or two of break in. My only complaint is that they are difficult to wear with glasses but nothing unmanageable. V-Moda, you have earned a customer through this stellar set of headphones. Vene Vidi Vici
customer_reviews.author: Tarek Vaughn-Orton

customer_reviews.title: great sound but doesn't last well with sweat / if used with working out
customer_reviews.text: Used this for years. After the first 6-12 months I noticed it was getting really gross from working out and the chrome was chipping in addition to the ear cushions themself which were pealing. I should note that I used it exclusively for lifting and running - I was very active during this time. Sound is incredible so no problems there, I was just sad to see how gross they had become, but I probably should have taken better care of them.
customer_reviews.author: LF1008

customer_reviews.title: Impressive headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a decent headset + mic to use with my android phone. After returning the Sennheiser Momemtum Headphones (only work with friggin' iPhones), I ordered the V-MODA Crossfade. The headset arrived without incident, and I'm loving them already. They're nice and big, very comfy, and the materials are excellent. This is what I'd expect for $200 or more with any other brand. Sound isolation works great, and my music now sounds like it should have all along :) As with all V-MODA products, the packaging is beautiful. Unless you need or want something super-fancy, these are perfect for listening to music while out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Thornburgh

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable headphones
customer_reviews.text: This was my Xmas gift to myself last year- I love these things. I wear them to mow and general purpose of listening to music. These things are durable, comfortable and great sound. The cord has a pause play button and volume up/down that is very easy to use and the cord is a good length for me. I do wish they were louder, but that could just be my hearing loss due to years of loud music. FYI- I went and listened to beats by dre, and all the other headphones at Target and Best Buy... these have just as good sound quality for the everyday guy/gal kind of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality - Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses, I wear contacts. This set, is comfortable with either. I love the sound quality, the high quality offset angled cord, the pause and volume control in the cord, and the fact that the sounds or distractions outside the headset, are dimmed drastically. Excellent in home set - even wore them while running once. written 2014. ***New Edit 03/26/2018 All of a sudden the headband material is peeling and disintegrating. I expected the material to last. This peeling is not normal wear and tear, but happened within the last two weeks. I am going to contact the company and see how they hand it.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Quality and stylish headphones
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've bought in terms of quality/durability and sound. Still going strong after a few years of heavy usage. Every day for two years I traveled with them on in rain, shine, or snowstorm (they make wonderful earmuffs in winter). Bass is phenomenal and even the highs are pretty good. Beats a lot of them in its price range and a lifetime warranty is always an added bonus. I loved the ability to customize the decal on the ear plates. I simply uploaded a design of my own that fit the guidelines to the company website and waited a few weeks for the results to be sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: kewlchic15

customer_reviews.title: Headband Frays
customer_reviews.text: Low rating for long term quality. The material used for ear & headband is nice & soft but very prone to fraying & looking very trashy. They have replacement ear cushions for only $20 but haven't supplied a solution for the headband. I called to see what could be done & they said they don't sell that part (which would be easy to replace) --- instead they tried to upsell me on buying a new pricey set...
customer_reviews.author: austexsun

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far, these headphones are great. I would say that they are missing a little midrange. I believe they are probably made for rap/techno/dance genres. Like many others, I burned them in--that is, let them play for over 24 straight hours with relatively loud music. The difference was very noticeable. So give them a fair chance; burn them in. I've been working too much to really get much of a chance to enjoy them, but so far, I'm impressed. I say so far, as I've purchased other headphones, to only have them fail after a short period of time...some not work at all after a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Loodis

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable and great sound
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 6 years the rubber black coat peeled off but a grayish fabric took over, I still use the same cord and paint intact. Sounds still amazing comparable to beats but for price, quality and reliability hands down you won't be buy another every other year. Not a true noise canceling but it block most sounds I can fall asleep in an airport, I've worn this in 6-8+ hrs and not having any pain on my ears or drop of sweat.
customer_reviews.author: JCas

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: The good: 1. Very good noise isolation. 2. Sound quality is superb, but then again I have been using kit ear-buds. 3. Fairly compact, for an over the ear headphone, and yet it is very comfortable. 4. Cable looks very solid, two sets! one with mic, the mic works ok on my Andriod phone. 5. Comes with a case, compact and solid, well designed, maybe by Martians. The bad: 1. Volume control on the cable does not work with w. Galaxy note 2, probably neither some other andriod phones. It was designed for iPhone. The great: Got it for $75 on Cyber Monday!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: 16yr Daughter has not removed them! LOVES them.
customer_reviews.text: 16yr old daughter wanted headphones to go with new iPhone as a dad that does sound (enjoys my Bose) I accidentally came across these reviews were great (thanks to everyone) my daughter has had these on non stop, the sound it ABSOLUTE Amazing out of them... She now wants the color plates. they are extremely comfortable, come with a great case, cables, they do have a slight weight to them but not bad.. I would seriously match these up any day against Beats, Bose (not noise canceling) Sony, anyone, for the $120 ticket paid they are well worth them..
customer_reviews.author: trainersteven

customer_reviews.title: Two
customer_reviews.text: They were the best sounding headphones I've heard while they lasted. I've only been using them for about a year before the right headphone driver gave out with no warning whatsoever. The reviews always rave how amazing the build quality is, but I still treated then like a newborn baby, always putting the hard shell case and never throwing around. My cheap Sony zx 300 headphones (around $20), I've been using for the last four years still work fine, even though I've treated it like hell. If I'm going to pay $130 for a pair of headphones, a cheap $20 pair shouldn't outlast them.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett Miles

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! That’s all the words I can describe these. These headphones have been with me for a very long time and I still do not have a issue with these anyone who wants something that last get these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pelter

customer_reviews.title: Just great!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying these headphones and I was not disappointed. These sound amazing, have GREAT build construction which is vital because I am a college student throwing these into backpacks and hauling across campus every day, with a great cable. People that I have called have been able to hear me clearly. They are noise-isolating (which I wanted, my roommate talks all the time) but if there's no music playing I can hear people relatively well (although I usually slide one side off my ear for better clarity). Overall I love these headphones and this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey Small

customer_reviews.title: Great Looks; Comfortable; But . . . .
customer_reviews.text: I bought these August 2011 as an alternative to the Sennheiser HD-448 that I had bought from Amazon March 2011. The V-Moda look much better, and have good quality, but the bass is quite pronounced. Now I do like bass, but the trebles seem clipped when I compare both units on the same iPad with the same songs. It is quite noticeable whether instrumental or vocals. Each of us have personal preferences, but I thought it worth noting for those wanting clarity over bass. These are visually very nice units with good quality, but I prefer the sounds produced by the Sennheiser HD-448.
customer_reviews.author: Phil H

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best-sounding headphones on the market for the money. Break 'em in (play them for 24 hours at medium volume) and take a listen. I was absolutely blown away by the sound of these bad boys, the bass, mids and highs perfectly balanced for me and they block out everything around me. Construction looks solid, and the braided cords included along with the neat storage case made it one of the best purchases I have made in the electronics world in quite sometime! I can actually discern between lower bit-rate MP3 and FLAC audio songs now. You can hear every detail music has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: hitech

customer_reviews.title: Build quality alone on these things is phenomenal...
customer_reviews.text: Build quality alone on these things is phenomenal, the breakaway braided audio cable is the biggest feature for me as it's saved these headphones from a fall more than once, and saved me from getting my head jerked around more than that. Decent sound and very comfortable as well, my favorite pair of headphones i've ever owned. Would recommend if you are having trouble getting cheaper devices to last, or are looking for an all metal contruction.
customer_reviews.author: galiosucks

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am given a Dodge 2500 crew cab diesel to drive for work. The truck is very loud, especially on the freeway. I even have to shut the truck off to order in drive thru because they cannot hear me over the truck. The Blackberry headphone work well but still had trouble hearing the caller sometimes. I am very pleased with these headphones. I read the other reviews before buying but I can say for my needs they are perfect. I can hear the other person just fine no matter the condition and though I read that the mic was not very good, I have had no problems with anyone hearing me even while using the skype program.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reive

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: These things rock! I was tired of "in the ear" headphones and I wanted something with some muscle for once. I scored these on sale and I couldn't be happier. 2 things I love about these headphones is that it blocks out a lot of the noise around you, and it doesn't have much sound bleed. I can sit on the train listening to my music and it won't bother anyone sitting around me because they don't hear anything. The sound is very clean and the bass is just fine where it is. The packaging that it comes in is pretty fancy and the storage case for the headphones is VERY nice. I love these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rawr

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I own
customer_reviews.text: Slightly heavy and I think these should come with the marshmallow pads from the factory but everything else top notch. Sound quality is still excellent just a little heavy on the bass which I like. Case it comes with and accessories are very durable. I also purchased the boom mic and it's awesome both connected to the headphones and as just something I can hang around my neck and use my speakers. I have a large head and ears, and generally hate wearing headphones but can wear these for 6hrs before they get uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: The anti "Beats".  These actually sound good.  :)
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is tops and the sound is above average. They're currently making great ear warmers for the winter. Haha. My only complaint would be that the don't fold in and the metal hinge tends to cut in to your collarbone, when they're rest around your neck. Not the worst, but not great either. I also love that I got a great deal for them. They sound way better the poser brand Beats and only cost a fraction of the practice of anything comparable from Dr. Dre. I'm almost tempted to get a laser etched replaceable plate for these (you can do that) for $25 to $45.
customer_reviews.author: Iva D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My greatest set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest pair of headphones I used in my life. It's easily compared to my Beats Pro, Beats Studio 2.0. It's not as much bass as the Beats, but it doesn't disappoint one bit. I hate having in earbuds because they bother me a lot. And most of the over ear headphones out there are tight on a large size head, which I have. I have listen to music with these on for 8 hours straight 3 days in a row and love them. They are a bit heavy but I got used to them. Love the custom plate feature.
customer_reviews.author: chuifam

customer_reviews.title: They're Money
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are as good as or better than the $300 Bose noise canceling (the noise isolating isn't as good as noise canceling btw but the V-moda noise isolating takes care of 80-90% of airplane noise), better clarity than the Beats Studio or by far better than any other headphones your local Best Buy carries. I've listened to all of them and these (esp for the price) are hands down the best thing you can buy that I've listened to. The build quality of these headphones is beyond belief, every detail has been taken into consideration during design. Long story short just buy them, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M Baute

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good all around but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The headphones aren't nearly as heavy as a lot of people were describing. They sit just fine. They sound great, and they look awesome. I've had them for about a month or two now and have had zero problems. My only thing is that since the ear-coverings don't fold or anything and that metal piece is there, it's not comfortable to just let it sit around your neck, especially if it hits/rests on your collar bones. Otherwise I enjoy them quite a bit. You can hear music a little from the outside when you wear them if you have the volume up on the higher end, but who cares.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Design: really good-looking headphones in most people's eyes. Durability: no worry of it breaking in years. Comfort: quite comfortable with its memory foams. Sound: it sounds very impressive; highs are crisp, mids are clear, and the lows are strong. I would compare it with the sennheiser HD25-1 II, only that the crossfade lp may have a bit too much bass for some of you guys. (Fine with me) Isolation and Sound Leakage: really outstanding; you will be satisfied. Notes: this pair of headphones needs some serious burn-in... Overall: the vmoda crossfade lp is an amazing pair of headphones at the price, and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HenryF_0

customer_reviews.title: My observation -
customer_reviews.text: This is just my observation as I gifted these to my son - but I could hear what he was listening to very clearly almost as if they had an outside speaker which I thought as very odd. I had to send him to his room to listen to them so I didn't have to hear them. Not sure why this was and he since has moved out on his own. Purchased these about 2 years ago (Dec. 2013) and just now catching up on the reviews so maybe this was an anomaly.
customer_reviews.author: BMUR

customer_reviews.title: Best value for DJ headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic value for the price. It includes a carrying case, two wires, and two quarter inch adapters (which is gold when it comes to DJing). The headphones are light, durable, and the cans are very powerful while maintaining a controlled bass sound. The only two complaints I have are that 1) it's a snug fit and 2) they don't swivel. Those are the only two things preventing it from being a five-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Lemus

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love. I was looking for a good pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love. I was looking for a good pair of over-the-ear headphones with a mic and decided on these after reading several reviews for several different pairs. I'm impressed. I've been using them for only a couple days but so far I can say that they are extremely comfortable, sound quality is great, and the mic seems to work as it should. If you're looking for a pair of over-the-ear headphones that are solid quality but not hundreds of dollars, I highly recommend these to you.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pair of headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Vmoda's! they sounded great and then I added a FiiO DAC/Amplifier to them and WOW! Now the sound is phenomenal! I sometimes fall asleep with them on, if any of you have done this you can attest to this, falling asleep with headphones will wreck them if you roll to your side with them on. Not these! They twist and bend and will not break. and they bump! and Thump! Add an amplifier and this headphone comes alive! They get LOUD without distorting! I mean" you'll get a headache" loud. Deep, tight base, ok mids and good, clear heights. Like I said....I love my Vmoda's!
customer_reviews.author: kssr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for startup Djs needing a more serious set of headphone on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are boss. The quality in them is fantastic for the price range they are in. Good bass to them, but not too much. Decent cancelation of the environment (though I have not tried them in truly loud environments). I use them mainly for Djing, but their unique look makes them really standout when I'm playing. Love that the headphone line is detachable from the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuele R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones with superb audio quality. However, the sound quality began to slowly degrade over the course of about six months. Subtle, but noticeable. The inner lining on the band also degraded and began to flake and peel after about six months of use. Otherwise, they were great.
customer_reviews.author: Chloei

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: these things are great. sound is very nice, highs are clean, as well as mids and the lows are nice and deep. the steel that holds the cups to the head band is made of a nice strong feeling metal. the clamping force is a little more then im used to but, i do have a pretty big head and its not to uncomfortable. i dont have a use for the inline mic but nothing to complain about. i plan on getting custom side plates soon. the carry case is super nice looking. and fairly strong.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Barco

customer_reviews.title: We buy these for all our programmers
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones for the price. They produce fantastically smooth sound across the spectrum. For people in a busy and often loud office, they make work not just possible but enjoyable. For people who care about the music they listen to, you won't believe the quality. You can do better with some insanely high end s***, but not at this price. They're also durable and come with nice cases and cords. If I had to change anything, I'd drop the bass down a little bit softer. But that's an audio nut talking -- these are really great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound, but very uncomfortable for listening for more than 30 min. Presses way too hard against the ears. It is quality product all around, but the obsession with details is borderline on unnecessary - do i really care that a carton box has a Velcro or that there is a logo on everything I touch? Almost feels sophomoric in this over the top approach. Unfortunately, when it comes to comfort it really falls short. I ended up simply giving mine away to a friend and use more comfortable headphones myself.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Pronin

customer_reviews.title: Sits very tightly, painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: These things sound great, amazing bass response, good sturdy build, very durable headband. The detachable cable is really useful for storage. The pads are a bit stiff, but I assume that goes away over time. I actually had to return this product because it hurt so much to wear. I don't have a big head (I wear small helmets when snowboarding) but these things would literally crush the sides of my head, after about half an hour of use, the pain became unbearable. I settled on some Bose AE2s which i'm very satisfied with.
customer_reviews.author: S. Baulch

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Product
customer_reviews.text: These headphones lasted me forever and offered me sound quality my friends' couldn't, even at much higher price tags. The only defect is the pressure they make on your head, which ultimately leads to slight headaches. I don't know to fix it, I think that's inherent to headphones, at least for now.
customer_reviews.author: Philippe

customer_reviews.title: Well-priced, solid headphones. One caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Quality sound range, build, and design for the price. I highly recommend upgrading the earpads to the "V -Moda XL memory cushions". If you do not get these right away, be aware that if your ears touch the grill of the headphones in anyway, the grill fabric cover and grill itself will eventually develop a grout of dead skin cells and ear wax. You can clean this routinely if you wish, but can sneak up on you if you forget for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: My ears..
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, they sound great, look awesome, and fit nice and snug. There is down side which is actually what compelled me to write this review. After about a half hour of using them they really start to squeeze my ears and head and i have a very petite head and face. Ow. I rather not have a headache every time I use my headphones and I use them daily. Also, sound leaks, roommate always complains she hears my music blaring out. Makes you be self conscious about the leaking sound wherever I wear them now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and haven't had a chance to use them on a plane yet. When used at home, they are really noise isolating, as described. When using an iPhone 4S, good clarity, deep, rich bass without much distortion. I will amend this review after wear on a 5 hour flight. While not completely noise isolating in a small commuter jet for 3 hours, they did deliver rich sound even at full volume. I found the bass lacking a bit, but earlier reviews note that the headphones take some time to break in. I really like the design, the feel and the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Shinran

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later
customer_reviews.text: I love them. I throw them in my backpack along with the removable headphone wire and I use them several times a day for conference calls. The build quality is excellent. The performance improvement is very noticeable, and not just in terms of bass. It is extremely clear across the entire spectrum. So much so that I've had family and friends do an A to B comparison using the same source device and they were all like, Whoa. Great headphones. Good price. Superb quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nphocus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, clear and deep.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clarity, deep bass and sturdy design make these a great addition to my phone. The case is also sturdy and has survived being in my cramped carry on bag through multiple countries. They cup around your ears blocking out noise much better than any other headphones I have tried. I had some klipsch headphones and really liked them, but one of my kids messed up the cord. With the V-Moda, the cord is extremely tough and can unplug from the headphones itself (excellent idea). If you don't mind spending the money, I think you'll be more than happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Brant B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are pretty good headphones with really only one downfall. I compared these to some cheap Sony's, Monster N-Tune, beats tour. I'm not an audio pro, but i can distinguish good sound. These have a pretty good sonic range, with an excellent mid range. Vocals come through nicely on these. Highs are not of the tin can sound, and have a natural tone. The bass on these are not as powerful as the N-Tunes or the beats tour. It is enough though. Pro's- Sound quality smooth bass, not over powering comfortable nice case removable cord Con's this thing leaks sound. Terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Book of Kings

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  WOW!  WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, best headphones we've ever used. This was my daughter's third pair of headphones. She is a musician and very picky about the quality. I researched and researched before deciding on these. I read pages full of reviews on amazon and other sites. Overall, these are the highest quality we could find in our price range. Best tip I found: turn them on high and leave music playing into them overnight to break them in, and the sound becomes amazing --- TOTALLY TRUE! The sound actually got better by day 2 of constant playing, and honestly, these are just amazing. Now I want a pair for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Seminary Chick

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: I own 30+ headphones. These headphones easily beat many in higher price ranges in sound quality as well as in visual design. In my view, their strength or character compared to other headphones is, that they have powerful but still very well defined BASS. Highs and mids seems to be tuned to assist the bass to stand out. highs are clear, mids are somewhat weakend but are still appropriately fitted to make music sound overall powerfull, real and well defined. If you like bass, you'll love these headphones as I do.
customer_reviews.author: vinsap

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Defiantly worth the 100 or so bucks, especially if your a student like me. The case along with the two separate cords allow for use on a desktop and with a quite unplug from the headphone and a zip into the case it is really easy to lug around. sound cancellation is 100% can't hear anything it produces if someone is wearing it, removing worries in public that others might hear your music, for what ever reason, no matter how loud.if your big headed like me, they start to wear on your ears after a few hours; but for me that is nothing more than a reminder to take a break.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: If you use your phone as much as I do. BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I bought these for my iphone 6 as I had an otterbox on it and had poor audio during phone calls. These are great for phone calls. My hearing is not what is was and in noisy environments these are the cat's meow. I purchased the memory foam pads and can wear these for hours! also bought the boom mike and cable and can talk in noisy environments like airports without an issue with background noise. Nice clam shell case fits all the cables and stows inside my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: raylap

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these V-Moda Crossfade LP's when it was the deal of the day on Amazon. I got them for cheap n figured i mine as well. Well after recieving a beautifully packaged box, i knew i did the right thing. The exoskeleton case is awesome too. Now 4 the actual headphones...theyre incredible! Point blank PERIOD!!! Buy them! I listen to all music n havent found a genre that sounds bad. Theyre especially nice for the Hip Hop Heads...which is what I mainly am. An old hip hop head at that. I enjoy Classic Rock too n all of it sounds great in these. Finally, they look gorgeous! I got the gun metal n u cant go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: 1DopeBloke

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones for my wife, who is a wedding DJ. We had Beats MIxR headphones, but they were not comfortable to wear, and they headband broke during normal use.(putting them on my head) We tried various headphones and were never happy with any of them. Until we got the V-Moda Crossfade LP headphone. These are great, they are comfortable, they sound as good as any headphones we have ever tried. They seem well made, and the included case is great for storing them. I also went to the V-Moda website and got custom shields for them
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Halstead

customer_reviews.title: "A+" for sound & design, "F" for call/volume controls and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: OK. First the good. They look and sound great! Now the bad. The call/volume controls didn't work. Also, the headphones had a very tight fit and were very uncomfortable. For my money (and for any headphones over $100) you have to deliver great sound (which these do have), great design/look (which these have), great reliability (which I found lacking when I received a pair with broken call/volume controls), and great comfort (which, for me, these were not). Big head? Think every thing should work? Consider going elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: They were pretty good, a little lacking on base
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned Byerdynamic DT770 PRO 80 Ohms. They were pretty good, a little lacking on base, and the left ear would have a buzzing like a mosquito in my ear when I turn them up higher. These V-Moda's are great! The bass is punchy and defined, not muddy. Definition is great across the board but highs and mids might be a little recessed. These are great for EDM, Electric, Hip Hop. I highly recommend these. They look, feel, and sound like quality headphones. I highly prefer these to the Byers.
customer_reviews.author: JetEyeNight

customer_reviews.title: Great looking headphones but too much bass and not so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after so many reviews and when i received these looks amazing but sound quality was not as good as i expected. Too much bass. I am into trance and progressive house music from years and owns AKG, Sennheiser, Technics, Pioneer, Beyerdynamics and Audio Technica headphones and sound quality is extremely important for me. they were also not so comfortable and my ears start hurting after 2 hours of use. Maybe they are good for newly listeners but for me they are okay.
customer_reviews.author: Vibez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of headphones. It fits comfortably, and the sound is excellent. The material that goes around the ears is very comfortable, and feels kind of like memory foam. The chords are covered in fabric rather than rubber, and there's two, one of which is of a decent length. I have a large head, and it fits well without going to the largest settings. The hard case that comes with it is also a nice touch. Not sure why they market these as "lifestyle" headphones. It's a great product without pretending like someone would wear it as an accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones, but cord came broken!
customer_reviews.text: Ahh, love these headphones so much! The red is such a pretty, deep red. Not TOO flashy, but bright and shiny enough to get people to do a double take. Noise isolation is good, but not 100%, which I like. They are small enough to fit in backpack, but easy to adjust and fit perfectly over the ears. I give 4 stars not 5 because cord came broken, so I have to either contact V-Moda for a replacement, or buy another $15 one.
customer_reviews.author: Song

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are possibly the best headphones I could have ever bought. Before diving in I did a ton of research and wound up with these. I've had them for four years now and they haven't lost a beat (get it?)! As long as you put them in their case when you're done using them, they stay looking new and beautiful. The sound quality is great and never sounds muddy. If you're worried about the price, don't be. You will get your use out of them!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: mainstream, strong, best sound
customer_reviews.text: this is the best headphones ever, it will never distort on your phone or portable player. some reviews paint it as very bassy but i find it is not bad, nothing your equalized wont fix. it isolates noise well the ear cups are very comfortable- roomy. built to last, well constructed. am not sure if i should make blanket statement but the volume rocker on the cable wont work with older iPod, well at least mine (iPod touch (3rd generation).
customer_reviews.author: E.Noeline

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile but everything sounds great with plenty of bass. The over ear design cuts out lots of the ambient noise when I'm on a long flight. I bought a $3 male to male connector to connect both the included wires along with the included adaptor that goes into my home theater receiver and it works great for me to watch TV at full volume while my wife is asleep. Great purchase, definitely would recommend. I'm waiting for their battery powered wireless bluetooth version... Hopefully they make them
customer_reviews.author: jliu

customer_reviews.title: Great headset but a tad small for some
customer_reviews.text: Great audio quality, great fit and finish, looks great, sounds great... but smallish for my head size. Granted, my hat size is on the big side, but these fit like a vice grip when I got them. I finally took the recourse of bending the metal supports to get a reasonable amount of tension. Also, even at full extension, they're a tad short for a proper fit in that regard. I'm not sure what my hat size is but I think it's 7 3/4 or 7 7/8, so if you're anything at or above that size be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Sandstone

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal !
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I purchased the V-Moda LP's for my daughter, at first they sounded a little muffled but I gave them a chance and a good break in and am really impressed with the overall sound quality and their ability to block out background noise. Went to Best Buy first and listened to Bose, Beats and others costing over 2X the price. These are more comfortable and sound just as good if not better. Build quality is first rate, all the others are cheap plastic, even the cord is rugged being covered with Kevlar. Nice protective case and a extra cord seals the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M. Zizzi

customer_reviews.title: Been looking a long time for good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses, so finding headphones that do not put a lot of pressure on my glasses is very hard. My co-worker let me use his Crossfade LPs for a day. I listen to a fairly large grouping of music (video game ost/Rock/Metal/electric/etc..). With the V-MODA BoomPro Mic these become the best (in my opinion) PC headset for that price range. Pros: * Very comfortable ear pads * Accessories: BoomPro Mic, XL Ear Pads, custom side shields. * Included cables are very durable * Love the carrying case that comes with them CON: * None *
customer_reviews.author: matthew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome , love the base
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on reflex when I saw the amazing (daily) deal from Amazon. The reviews are great and I can hear why they are, They are comfortable on me and I love the bass they produce. I wish I had bought one of the color ones but the white has a very cool style and is still hip. I use it on my tablet and when I change the equalizer settings on a song I can really tell how these headphones work, very nice. I will be getting some of the colored shields when a deal comes up on them but I like them and the case they come in rocks.
customer_reviews.author: nickmarine

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, not so great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good sound for the price but they started fall apart after 2+ years of moderate use. Both ear cushions fell apart, top headband started peeling. They sound great but not very comfortable after 1-2 hour of use. I ordered new ear cushions from v-moda.com to replace the originals, hopefully I won't have to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, durable headphones with bass-heavy lean to them
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are extremely stylish and very comfortable. The memory foam earpads are a blessing. Construction is rugged and the kevlar-braided removable audio cables are fantastic. I also love the alien-looking case, which does a fine job protecting the headphones from damage. My only qualm is that the midrange and high end of the sound spectrum is a bit dull on these units. The bass is full and round. Overall, the sound is quite superior to any of the Dre Beats I've listened to. For the price I'm extremely happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M. Ozawa

customer_reviews.title: great Headphones, just got to try them out today ...
customer_reviews.text: great Headphones, just got to try them out today and so far I like what I hear. I only have one problem, for some reason the speak easy cable isn't working. I've tried it on my iPad my macbook pro and my android and all it picks up is the instrumental, but it echoes, and I can barely hear the vocals. The audio only cable works perfectly. Overall these headphones are very durable, they look nice and they have great sound quality. Oh and the case is pretty cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Carmelo P.

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are a life-saver!
customer_reviews.text: I love my headphones. I hesitated before buying them because they're kinda pricey and weren't exactly what I thought I wanted - I was looking for something active noise cancelling - but Bose were out of my price range at the moment, and everything else I saw had such horrible reviews. These don't do much for noise cancelling on their own, but as soon as one plays music, the surrounding world disappears. I'm always trying to work in noisy environments, and I realized I HAD to do something about my situation when I managed to write three sentences in 1.5 hours... For me, these headphones are a blessing!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Hammarblad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Got these a few years back and they are still working well. back them after reading a lot of reviews I determined these had the best bass. But beware, their sound improves after you break them in. I want to say around 20 hours you'll notice a improvement in sound. Might be less, hard to remember since that was several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels like my ears are in a night club
customer_reviews.text: I have owned headphones from Shure, Beats, Sennheiser, Bose, Sony, Philips, Skull Candy, you name it and all the other headphones werent just $10 but all over $100 and the V-Modas just kill the competition. It feels like you are in a studio, night club with high end sound system. The highs and lows are perfectly balanced, when you need the highs they are there and when the lows come in they do not over power the highs or mids. Acoustics can be cleared depicted in nice clear sound. I have even noticed in some songs the crackling sound from the studio you sometimes hear. I purchased these for DJing and could not be happier they out performed my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaDelta

customer_reviews.title: Amazing...for a while
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great! The materials are also top-notch. The wires are not some cheap plastic ones you get with other headphones and it it also removable which is a great thing. The packaging is also very sturdy and fashionable. Unfortunately, the headband eventually wore down and started tearing. It's a shame since the design is fantastic, but once the tears start happening, it really becomes a massive eyesore. But lasted 2 years, so keep that in mind!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, great look as well!
customer_reviews.text: Solid pair of headphones - got them as an amazon flash deal and couldn't be happier. Sound - pretty great overall, and no issues or complaints Style - they look great, complimented often Case is great, very protective. Cable is great as it has the in line remote and mic. Seem pretty durable overall, have had for 5 months w/o issue thus far. Negatives - the ear pads it comes with are good for the average person but if have larger ears, may want to upgrade to the XL cushions - I did that and now its an even better fit! Very comfy.

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite
customer_reviews.text: I JUST received these beauties and am SO Impressed with the quality all the way around and the incredible value. I am a bit older and listen to Miles Davis, A Lot of Argentine Music, Latin Jazz. etc. and these do this great music justice, believe me. These are better than headphone I have paid hundreds of dollars for. BUY THESE! ( BTW I am a petite woman and have a small head and this has been a problem with several high end brands.. NOT ThESE.. they also expand to fit a HUGE head i might add;) VERY comfortable noise canceling phones..) Thank You V- MODA.
customer_reviews.author: peony8702

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me sane at the office
customer_reviews.text: Not "noise cancelling" but when you are playing music through them, it blocks out all noise going on around you, which is PERFECT for my very open office space (low-walled cubicle farm). I got worried that other people may be able to hear the music I'm listening to because it will play so loudly through the headphones, but when I tested it out, you couldn't hear a thing coming from the headphones. When I forget my ipod, sometimes I will just put them on to keep co-workers from asking me unimportant questions and these headphones have a serious enough presence to work as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

product_meta.title: V-MODA Crossfade LP Over-Ear Noise-Isolating Metal Headphone (Phantom Chrome)
product_meta.description:
Color:ClearV-MODA Crossfade LP headphones are the result of over four years of research and development collaborating with some of the worlds top artists, products and DJs. The revolutionary metal design, patent pending 50mmm Multimodal HD drives, premium materials and ultimate ergonomic comfort create the most sophisticated headphone on the market. Our award winning sound and signature bass make the Crossfade LP the best headphone for listening to all music genres from the street to the stage.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


“When it comes to the most important feature for headphones -sound quality-
V-MODA's Crossfade LP definitely delivers.” -About.com Why LP?  *  Superior Sound Unrivaled Durability Comfort, Customization, Style Portability Detachable Microphone & Audio Cables 
   

Superior Sound 
"Sound quality of the V-MODA Crossfade LPs is phenomenal." -DJ Mag

Immersive 3D Soundstage… evokes the experience of a live performance
Vibrant Bass… don't just hear the music, feel it in absolute BLISS from the outside world
Vivacious Highs & Vivid Midrange… hear lifelike vocals, clear cymbals and crispy hi-hats

- - -

"Ultimate versatile and multipurpose headphone, Crossfade LP is made for people on the move at the gym or on the stage." -E!
"an essential part of my life, not just on the road but in the studio. I could never defect to another model or brand" -Funkagenda - DJ, Producer, Sound Engineer

view Crossfade awards and reviews

- - -
Crossfade LP's superior sound is created by:  *  50mm Dual-Diaphragm Driver (Patent Pending): Inner and outer rings separate the bass from bleeding into the mids and highs Master Crafted Materials: More expensive driver and components than peer headphones at this price range Musician + DJ Collaboration: Over 50 legendary musicians and DJs collaborated on the sound, durability and features of Crossfade Analog Noise Isolation: Naturally cut out the distractions of jet engines, crying babies and crowd noise
   No Batteries or Artificial Processing: Powerful, pure sound without the two extra digital-to-analog conversions of battery powered headphones that pollute the purity of your music Minimal sound leakage: Immersive sound for you without bothering others view details Consistent Driver Quality: The spectacular sound is quality tested at 6 frequencies to maintain stricter consistency than the competition, often by an order of magnitude

Durability: Built to Last
"Built like a tank. For when you need a pair of 'phones that not only play beats but can take a beating" -Thrilist
 *  Virtually Indestructible STEELFLEX Headband Steel Frame and Interchangeable Aircraft Grade Metal Shields Exoskeleton Form-Fitting Case Tested Beyond Military-Level Quality MIL-STD-810G Test Standards  * Kevlar Reinforced Cable/Plug Bend: Cables and 45-degree plug can bend over 1 million times (100x industry standard)
    * Concrete Drop: Survives 70+ drops on concrete from 6 feet (10x industry standard)
    * Headband Bend: Steelflex can bend 10+ times flat
    * Environmental: High and low temperatures, humidity, salt spray and UV exposure
   
   

Which One is for You?

reveal shield kit reveal shield kit reveal shield kit Warranty 2 Year + Immortal Life 50% 2 Year + Immortal Life 50% 1 Year + Immortal Life 50% 2 Year + Immortal Life 50% View / Compare the entire V-MODA Product Line Comfort, Customization, Style
"You can wear cookie cutter headphones and look like everyone else, or you can wear V-MODA." -Morgan Page, Producer/DJ

 * Inspired in Italy, Styled in Hollywood: Stylish colors and metal beats plastic headphones
 * 3+ Years of Ergonomic R&D: Resulted in an ergonomic headband and hexagon shape that contours to the natural lines of your facial features and minimizes gaps
 * Supple BLISS Memory Foam Cushions: Naturally forms to your ears to provide ergonomic comfort and noise isolation for extended listening sessions
 *  Optional Custom Shield Kits: Laser engrave your logo, favorite team or change your shield color
 *  Optional Cables & Ear Cushions: Choose from a variety of color and feature options so that you have a different headphone than everybody else

Portable Exoskeleton Case  *  Form-Fitting Case: Store your headphones and gear in the included hard-shell case V-STRAP System: Organize included cables and 1/4" adapter via the V-STRAP systems inside the exoskeleton case, with extra room left over for your USB Flash Drive and Fader earplugs Carabiner: Safely clip your headphones on the outside of your bag for quick access


view larger Detachable Cables: Make the Call. Control it All.
 *  3-Button Mic Cable:3-button remote microphone cable controls your calls, music and volume on most smartphones and tablets including the latest Apple devices including iPhone, iPad, iPod, and Macbook (volume compatible only with Apple products) Audio Cable:Extended length audio-only cable and 1/4" adapter is universally compatible with all audio devices and professional equipment Optional BoomPro & SpeakEasy 1-Button Cables: Extend your functionality with a professional-grade boom mic for gaming and Skype or a SpeakEasy 1-button mic cable (not included)

Developed by Musicians & Travelers

V-MODA is the authentic music brand that fuses fashion and function. Headphones are essential tools for mobile producers and musicians who require unparalleled performance delivered reliably, night in and night out. The founder of V-MODA, also a producer and DJ, designed the M-100 to deliver professional sound yet withstand even the rigorous needs of globetrotting travelers. V-MODA's professional pedigree is shown through a clear history of innovation: the Hex design, product, drivers, CliqFold, SharePlay, V-CORK, packaging and accessories are all patented or patent pending.

The Crossfade series was master crafted by the people - over 200 audiophiles, editors, artists, DJs and Grammy-winning musicians collaborated for years on the tuning and features of the line. V-MODA utilized hundreds of prototypes to gain feedback from the collective masterminds of the best in the business to create the ultimate versatile and customizable headphone.
Satisfaction Guaranteed
One Year Warranty - Immortal Life Program - 60-Day Test Drive Guarantee: Each Crossfade LP purchased from a Verified Reseller is backed by a 1-Year V-MODA Premier Warranty. In the unlikely event you run over your headphones with a tank, with the V-MODA Immortal Life Program, you get 50% off a replacement for a lifetime. V-MODA is so confident the Crossfade LP is a superior headphone, it even offers an unrivaled 60-day test drive guarantee.
Technical Details
 *  What's included: Crossfade LP, Exoskeleton carry case, carabiner, Kevlar reinforced 3-button remote + mic cable, Kevlar reinforced extended audio cable, 1/4" pro adapter, cleaning cloth, instant six-star support code Type: Over-Ear Circumaural Frequency Response: 5 - 30,000 Hz Sensitivity: 105 dB @ 1kHz 1mW Impedance: 32Ω Weight: 260g
